meanings.definition: Forming an opinion or idea before having full knowledge or information.
meanings.sent1: She made a preconceiving judgment about the new student without getting to know them first.
meanings.sent2: It is not wise to make preconceiving assumptions about a situation without all the facts.
meanings.sent3: He realized his preconceiving thoughts about the movie were completely wrong after watching it.
meanings.sent4: Her preconceiving attitude towards the project limited her ability to see its true potential.
meanings.sent5: The preconceiving notion that all snakes are dangerous is not always accurate.

meanings.sent1: Before the trip, she was preconceiving all the fun activities they would do.
meanings.sent2: He was preconceiving the speech in his mind while waiting for his turn to speak.
meanings.sent3: The children were preconceiving a magical land where anything was possible.
meanings.sent4: She was preconceiving a future where all her dreams had come true.
meanings.sent5: Preconceiving the outcome of the experiment helped them plan their next steps effectively.
